p: Lycorine ( Figure 5) is a toxic crystalline alkaloid found in various Amaryllidaceae species, such as the cultivated bush lily ( Clivia miniata), surprise lilies ( Lycoris), and daffodils ( Narcissus). It has also demonstrated a potent antiviral effect against SARS-CoV. Several previous investigations suggest that lycorine seems to have broad antiviral properties and has been reported to have an inhibitory action on the Herpes simplex virus (HSV, type I) [ 67] and Poliomyelitis virus [ 68].
